cat.lump.ie.textprocessing

Class TextPreprocessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • cat.lump.ie.textprocessing.TextPreprocessor

  • public class TextPreprocessor
extends java.lang.Object

    This class represents an "interface" to the different text processing tools available in this package.

    The currently available operations are:

    • toLowerCase()
    • removePunctuation()
    • removeDiacritics()
    • removeStopwords()
    • stem()
    • onlyAlphabetic(4)

        Note that a copy of the originally set string is stored and the changes are carried out on a copy

    Author:
    albarron

      • removeNonAlphaNumeric

        public void removeNonAlphaNumeric(int minimumSize)
        Remove any token which is not the in [:alnum:] character class. It also removes the tokens with a length lower than a minimum size.
        Parameters:
        minimumSize - Minimum size of accepted tokens. If equals to 0, all the tokens will be accepted

      • removeNonAlphabetic

        public void removeNonAlphabetic(int minimumSize)
        Remove any token which is not in [:alpha:] character class. It also removes the tokens with a length less than minimum size. However, a minimum size of 0 implies any length restriction.
        Parameters:
        minimumSize - Minimum size of accepted tokens. If it equals 0, all the tokens will be accepted

      • normalizeText

        public static java.lang.String normalizeText(java.lang.String text)
        Normalize the text by shrinking white spaces in one as well as substituting quotations, dashes and dots. TODO include an example
        Parameters:
        text -
        Returns:

      • normalizeAndDeAposText

        public java.lang.String normalizeAndDeAposText(java.lang.String text)
        Normalize the text by shrinking white spaces in one as well as substituting quotations, dashes and dots. It substitutes apostrophes by a space as a previous step for tokenisation with only BreakIterators
        Parameters:
        text -
        Returns:

      • setStringTokens

        public void setStringTokens(java.lang.String str)
        Stores a copy of the original string and generates a tokenized copy. Apostrophes are substituted by spaces as a previous step for tokenisation with only BreakIterators.
        Parameters:
        str -
